conclusion: Analyze the image to identify characteristics of the power source and the small light bulb.

The image shows two graphs: a straight line labeled A and a curved line labeled B. Line A is a U-I graph of a power source, and line B is a U-I graph of a small light bulb. The straight line A intersects the curved line B at a point marked by a red circle.
The problem involves finding the output power and the total power of a power source when connected to a small light bulb.

Line A represents the power source, which is a straight line indicating a constant current source. Line B represents the small light bulb, which is a curved line showing a non-linear relationship between voltage and current.
The intersection point of line A and line B indicates the operating point when the power source and the bulb are connected in a closed circuit.
The output power of the power source is determined by the current and voltage at the intersection point. Power is calculated as P = VI at the intersection point.
The total power of the power source includes the power dissipated by the bulb and the power lost in the source.
The total power can be calculated by summing the power dissipated by the bulb (area under line B up to the intersection) and any power loss in the source.
The output power of the power source is 2 W, and the total power of the power source is 3 W.
